@ viperrrr

I have the same problem.

PS3 cant play 2 files (the movie and the subtitle). In order to have the subtitle it has to be hardcoded into the movie, or you have to use some program on the PC and stream the files to the PS3. 

There is a PC program Aviaddxsubs that embeds the subtitles but it works only with .avi files. 

Unfortunatly, Sony still hasnt improved this issue (like the standard DVD players for the .srt files).

We can only hope that the movie will be ripped with its subtitles or wait.
Thank you for your reply DGray978/ Although i doubt Sony would ever condone piracy, we can only hope for support of external subtitles in the ps3.

@viperrr

As a spanish speaker i had the subtitle problem myself too, yet i found a solution. I download a matching .srt file (usually those meant for bdrips of the same movie work pretty fine) and then i make a BD format disk to be played on my BD player (LGBD370)
What i do is: mux the .m2ts and the .srt (or more than one if you please) using tsMuxeX_1.10.6. You must do a BD Disc in some folder of your choice. This will create a two-folder structure, just as though it was a real BD. Then using Nero I make an UDF disc and place the exact same two folders I created previously, and you're done!
My BD player recognises it as a real BD and plays it perfect.
Note that this works on a PS3 as well BUT it doesn't show subtitles at all, I dont know why.
Hope this helps. cheers

If any of you have problems watching HD mp4 or mkv files such as this one. 
And you already tried VLC media player then:
Download and install K-Lite Codec pack (Mega)
http://www.codecguide.com/download_k-lite_codec_pack_mega.htm
It includes media player classic which is very light on cpu power.
If you have Win 7 make sure you enable the DivX H.264 decoder.
After install under tools folder open Win7DSFilterTweaker.
Change decoders from 'microsoft' default option.
That's the key to playing back HD videos. 
Thanks for seeding.

@renaudparisfrance

What the fuck are you talking about? You are confused on more than one level. 

DiVX and XviD are compression codecs. Blue Ray is not a codec. It is a fancy name for a storage medium. 

You can get a 1080i down to 4g (or even 2gb) with Xvid or DivX. But they wont look near as good as h.264 (esp at the lower bitrates).

Next your dumbass is going to tell us how much better .avi is than dvd format! Make fucking sense, motherfucker!

By the way to the encoders/bricktophd, I uprated this to +3. 

1080i should be 4GB as a torrent. This is a practical size for the resolution as a non-raw.
I found problems playing with VLC & WMP. But after installing K-Lite Codec Pack it goes well with windows classic player. THANKS bricktophd....
